http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61356-Kerbal-Space-Program-Update-0-23-Launches-Tuesday-December-17?p=833262#post833262

Good Bye 0.22. The 1st to have career mode. The 1st to have suspension landing gear. The 1st to ......blah blah blah...

You will be remembered.

Edited December 12, 2013 by Sirine
spelling mistake
I will remember it forever.... Well maybe until a few minutes after I download .23
You will live on in my heart. In the name of SCIENCE.
Bye? (has to be more than 10 words)

Good knowing ya.

.23 is replacing you though. Don't be offended.
Well, at least Jeb and Bill aren't stranded on Eve anymore...
It's definitely my most-fondly-remembered version since 0.18 (though that one also has an edge since we had it for so long...).
it was fun! A smashing good time...

Well, at least Jeb and Bill aren't stranded on Eve anymore...

Thats remind me...where is my Jeb and Bill?

"Farewell 0.22, and we thank you."

"it was a good update!"

(i had to do that reference, okay?)

And of COURSE it would come out during the week that I'm away..

is this Karma? I didn't MEAN to fling Bill into the VAB at 200m/s, why am I being punished for it?

Makes me glad I held off on my manned Duna mission until after .23 had a release date. Now I fear for my rover enroute to Duna though, my hope is it will be fine since I see nothing that seems to suggest major changes incoming to the game.

0.22:

Ill always remember that kick off from Jool... Damn Laythe, My probe was meant to research Jool not the outer space!

And that Duna landing was awesome, now im going to send my last (and first) Manned mission to Eve.

I feel the need for a video.

.I will make a video....my first video and maybe my only.....I will use Camstudio to give you all an epic .22 final word
Really underwhelming update. Hope SQUAD gets their act together.
It will forever be the Update that changed how we play KSP, and the first iteration of Career mode.

Really underwhelming update. Hope SQUAD gets their act together.

Most games I have noticed when doing updates this early do one big one and then one smaller one, basically gets big fixes and new stuff out in the first one and fixes to the new stuff and smaller things in the second one. While I only got the game at .22 I am guessing this has been the trend for most of the games history, as seemingly when .22 hit it was a big upgrade to the current system in play. Oddly enough most of your bigger patches will be even numbers and smaller things will be odds, I think that is more luck of the draw than anything else though.

Thank you, 0.22, for giving me hours of joy. For being there when I wanted to fly airplanes. For being more stable with more mods than 0.21. And for that, I have made a backup so I can enjoy this forever more.

Yep, I can go all the way back to 0.18, when I started playing.

I laughed. I cried. It become a part of me. It was better than CATS.

For Science!Ã¢â€žÂ¢
The fixed RCS and SAS were the best

I wish Squad had learned their lesson about releasing dates ahead of time. Here is my prediction of what will happen in the next few days.

-The forums, especially General Discussion, will slowly be consumed by "ZOMG 0.23!!!!!" threads.

-At 12:01 AM on December 17, people will be whining about how the new update has not been released yet.

-When it finally does, the forums will be re-eaten with "SO WHAT ABOUT 0.24?!??!?!" threads.

I love this community... But around new updates, it is pretty predictable

And a slight bragging note, because I can... Still going strong since 0.13
I'm sorry .22, it's just not working out between us. I need more science, biomes and you know nothing of tweaking. It was fun, but winter is coming and we must part.

.18 here and lets just make a secret pact with everyone that reads this...... ( if you are reading this you are now legally bonded to this pact.. NO ESCAPE)

No uber posting OMG .23 threads when it comes out, there is bound to be some one that already posted one... Lets break the cycle and show the forum kraken who is KING!

You shall remain forever within Documents/KSP/Prev_Versions/

Unless I run out of hard drive space

Bye...

...

Okay, how long do you think it'll take for mod-makers to get everything updated for 0.23?
